Topic.Title: anybody else buying Sept puts at 640

Message.Msg: are reachable by expiration.. stock has been on a nice.. run... I have a few of the Sept 650 puts... stock reacted to the Apple verdict but no lasting effect.... long tern stock has vulnerabilities... the tom tom mobile app for android is nice.. google will still lose revenue from Apple moving away from google products... if google is a juggernaut then 2 quarters from now that lost revenue will be recouped from increased revenue someplace else.. if not.... stock will suffer... me... I'm betting against the google business model... motorolla will be a money loser for them... they see the handwriting on the wall (search won't be the cash cow grower that it once was)... and they are trying to expand into other businesses (phones, internet service provider, You tube tv programming, etc.)...I give them credit for seeing that search was/is a one trick poney... in the long run Google is toast... just my opinion..... but to some it's like saying Apple is toast... google is doing what yahoo failed to day transition to a real business...

Topic.Title: Which ON2/VP8's client/partner is NEXT on the list?

Message.Msg: Another top Zynga executive, Mike Verdu, departs By Alex Pham August 28, 2012, 5:18 p.m. Zynga on Tuesday said Chief Creative Officer Mike Verdu has left the San Francisco social gaming company. Verdu's announcement follows a string of high-level executive departures in recent months as the social gaming giant struggles to keep up its once-torrid pace of revenue and audience growth. Others who have left Zynga include John Schappert, its former chief operating officer, and Alan Patmore, who was the general manager of one of Zynga's top games, "CityVille." In addition, Erik Bethke, who was general manager of "Mafia Wars 2," Ya-Bing Chu, vice president in Zynga’s mobile division, and Jeremy Strauser, a general manager who oversaw development studios responsible for "Zynga Bingo" and several other casino games, also left this summer, according to Bloomberg. Zynga did not comment on the status of Strauser, Bethke or Chu. Strauser updated his LinkedIn profile to show that he had left Zynga earlier this month.
